replies.bodyText: @MioRtia It looks totally equivalent? Maybe the proposition @annetill mades is better because you clearly see that these two attributes are linked.
replies.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Not really: here if attributes are present in 1.1, they are not read but the import does not notice the file is invalid (unless there is validation after import) which contradicts what we did elsewhere. If we want to throw an exception if the attributes are present for version >= 1.1, a check outside the runUntilMaximumVersion method should be done.
replies.author: miovd
mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Yes, we should do something like that to be consistent with other compatibility checks.

replies.bodyText:
After some thinking, I think what we should do is:

assert the version when there is a deletion or an addition of an XML element
not assert anything where there is a deletion or an addition of an XML attribute

So @annetill you can keep your original code
